intro: Chaenorhinum viscidum f. australior, commonly known as the sticky-flowered horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a sticky texture. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive horn-shaped structure at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the family Scrophulariaceae.
